Water scarcity can lead to severe droughts and heatwaves, which can cause crop failures and food shortages.
It can lead to the spread of waterborne diseases, as clean water sources become scarce.
Water scarcity can also lead to political instability and conflict, as resources become limited and tensions rise over access.
The cost of water could increase significantly, leading to economic hardship for many communities.
It can lead to the depletion of natural habitats and ecosystems, as water sources become scarce and human needs take priority.
